intro: Boehmeria malabarica, commonly known as Malabar cotton or Malabar flax, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fibers are valued for their strength and are used in the production of textiles and paper. Boehmeria malabarica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
